decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): Site Location Plan and Site Block Plan 096_SLP; Existing East Elevation 096_PL008; Existing First Floor Plan 096_PL003, Existing North Elevation 096_PL006, Existing Ground Floor Plan 096_PL002; Existing South Elevation 096_PL007; Existing Roof Plan 096_PL005; Existing Second Floor Plan 096_PL004; Existing Section CC 096_PL012; Existing Section AA 096_PL010; Existing Section BB 096_PL011; Existing Site Plan 096_PL000; Existing West Elevation 096_PL009; Proposed Basement Plan Demolition 096_301; Proposed Basement Plan 096_PL101 rev A; Proposed East Elevation 096_PL108; Proposed First Floor Demolition Plan 096_PL303; Proposed North Elevation 096_PL106; Proposed Ground Floor Plan 096_PL102; Proposed Ground Floor Demolition Plan 096_PL302; Proposed Roof Plan 096_PL105; Proposed Roof Demolition Plan 096_P305; Proposed Second Floor Plan 096_PL104; Proposed Second Floor Demolition Plan 096_PL304; Proposed Section AA 096_PL110; Proposed Sectin BB 096_PL111; Existing and Proposed Windows details 096_PL1001; Proposed First Floor Plan 096_PL103 rev A; Proposed Site Plan 096_PL100 rev A; Proposed West Elevation 096_PL109 rev A; Proposed South Elevation 096_PL107 rev B; Planning Report 26.10.2023; Heritage Statement November 2023; External Materials Schedule; Design and Access Statement; Tree Constraints Plan; Tree Impact Plan; Arboricultural Report, Tree Constraints Plan & Impact Assessment dated 26.01.2024; Tree Survey.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
| No part of the roof of the extensions hereby approved shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the extensions hereby approved.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).
|  The hereby approved windows to all side elevations above ground floor level shall contain only obscure glass and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), policies policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012).
| The basement construction shall be in accordance with basement impact assessment provided in the supporting document "Planning Report" dated 26.10.2023.

Reason: To reduce adversely affect land stability and the existing building stability, including to adjacent sites of the application property, neighbouring properties, and local area in accordance with policy 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy), policies D10, SI 12 and SI 13 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).

| No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until a suitable scheme (Arboricultural Method Statement) for the protection of existing trees and hedgerows has been submitted and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works.  Details shall include the following:th

o	Tree protection plan of all trees within influencing distance and on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
o	A plan** detailing all trees and hedgerows planned for retention and removal.

o	A schedule of tree works for all the retained trees specifying pruning and other remedial or preventative work, whether for physiological, hazard abatement, aesthetic or operational reasons.  All tree works shall be carried out in accordance with BS 3998.
o	Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
o	Level changes

o	A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
o	Details of the arboricultural supervision schedule.
o	If trees are to be felled the tree protection plan must show the location of the replacement tree with size and species to be approved by the tree service.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G1 and G7 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.
description: Excavation to provide a basement level and lightwells; single storey rear and side extension; first floor rear extension incorporating Juliet balcony; insertion of a circular window to north elevation gable; alterations to east, north, west and south fenestrations; roof extension to rear (main) roofslope; part rear roof extension to rear outrigger roof slopes; rear dormer roof extension; alterations to the landscaping. (Following the demolition of part of the existing building)
